note.p: Education: Apprenticed to a medical practioner, London (1840); King's College, London (1842). MB (1846); MD

Career: Set up practice in Colchester (1848); Mayor of Colchester (1857); Professor of Geology, King's College, London (1870); Professor of Geology, Cooper's Hill College (1877); wrote especially on corals
Memberships: FGS (1849, President 1876-1878); Royal Microscopical Society (President 1881-1883)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1891-1892 vol 50 pp iv-vii
References: Susan Sheets-Pyenson, '"Pearls Before Swine": Sir William Dawson's Bakerian Lecture of 1870' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 177-191
